intro: Diodia virginiana var. attenuata, commonly known as narrowleaf sandplum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas.
